required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Diagnostic Imaging Study of 64Cu-SARTATE Using PET on Patients With Known or Suspected Neuroendocrine Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Positron Emission Tomography Imaging of Participants With Known or Suspected Neuroendocrine Tumours Using 64Cu SARTATE: A Multi-Centre, Single Arm, Non-Randomised, Blinded-Review, Phase II Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the performance of imaging agent 64Cu-SARTATE in participants with known or suspected Gastroenteropancreatic (GEP) Neuroendocrine Tumors (NETs) as a potential new way to help diagnose NETs.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 63 participants will be recruited in this study and who are confirmed or suspected to have NETs based on biochemical evidence or that of conventional anatomical or molecular imaging.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of diagnostic performance of 64Cu-SARTATE to that of 68Ga-DOTATATE on a per-lesion basis for discordant findings
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity on the 4-hour 64Cu-SARTATE PET/CT compared to 68Ga-DOTATATE PET/CT.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of diagnostic performance of 64Cu-SARTATE to that of 68Ga-DOTATATE on a per-lesion basis for discordant findings
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity on the 20-hour 64Cu-SARTATE PET/CT compared to 68Ga-DOTATATE PET/CT. Sensitivity and specificity on composite of 4-hour and 20-hour 64Cu-SARTATE PET/CT compared to 68Ga-DOTATATE PET/CT.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the proportion of concordance between 4-hour 64Cu-SARTATE to that of 68Ga-DOTATATE
primary_outcome.description: Concordance measured on a per-lesion basis

secondary_outcome.measure: To compare the diagnostic performance of 64Cu-SARTATE to 68Ga-DOTATATE on a per-participant basis in participants with suspected disease only.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 4 hours and 20 hours post administration of 64Cu-SARTATE
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity of the 4-hour 64Cu-SARTATE PET/CT compared to 68Ga-DOTATATE PET/CT. Sensitivity and specificity of the 20-hour 64Cu-SARTATE PET/CT compared to 68Ga-DOTATATE PET/CT. Sensitivity and specificity on composite of 4-hour and 20-hour 64Cu-SARTATE PET/CT compared to 68Ga-DOTATATE PET/CT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events related to 64Cu-SARTATE
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events will be graded using the national cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 5.0.

arm_group.description: 64Cu-SARTATE will be administered at a fixed administration dose of 200 MBq (5.4 mCi) given as a single bolus intravenous injection.

intervention.description: 64Cu-SARTATE will be administered at a fixed administration dose, single bolus intravenous injection, peptide mass not exceeding 20µg.
